results.name: a(1)=1, a(n+1)=sigma(a(n))-2*a(n).
comment: Taking any nonperfect number as initial value, does the map x->sigma(x)-2x lead to the cycle (-1,3,-2,7,-6,24,12,4) if during the iteration no perfect number is reached? Example: 124 -> -24 -> 108 -> 64 -> -1 -> 3 -> -2 -> 7 -> -6 -> 24 -> 12 -> 4 and the cycle (-1,3,-2,7,-6,24,12,4) is reached.
There appear to be lots of other cycles, for example the numbers in A005820 are cycles of length one. For longer cycles refer to the discussion in links. - _Hans Havermann_, Jul 21 2013
